etymology.interpretation: 酉 signals fermentation, alcoholic liquids, and by extension condiments, pointing to the meaning of a fermented sauce. 将/將 contributes the sound jiang and helps form the word family, while the overall structure keeps the flavor-related sense.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing the phonetic 將 with its simplified form 将 (⿰丬夕), reducing strokes while preserving pronunciation and the original phono-semantic structure.

parts.english: to lead; will; about to; take (coverb)

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃辣酱(我喜歡吃辣醬)。
examples.english: I like to eat spicy sauce.

examples.chinese: 她把面条拌上豆瓣酱(她把麵條拌上豆瓣醬)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ miàntiáo bàn shàng dòubànjiàng.
examples.english: She tossed the noodles with doubanjiang.

examples.chinese: 这道菜需要加一点酱油(這道菜需要加一點醬油)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài xūyào jiā yīdiǎn jiàngyóu.
examples.english: This dish needs a little soy sauce.
